intro: Hieracium sylvaticum subsp. macropholidium, commonly known as the large-leaved wood hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and broad, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in woodland and meadow habitats, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces a flowering stem with numerous flower heads. Its botanical features make it identifiable within the genus Hieracium, though it is often confused with other similar species.
